my first impression was nah thats just much worse than dd1 but i gave this game a chance played for 2 hours and it wasnt bad at all actually i dont like the consoleadopted strange ui maybe this idea with diligence is not the best but some things are cool like the stories of the characters pretty good

devs take risks and sometimes that doesnt always pan out the game is unique filled with heart and full of issues but its still worth playing risks are sorely lacking in the gaming industry these days and the developers are still working hard to make the game better with free update after free update be the change you want to see

a roguelite that takes far to long to complete one run ranging from an hour to two also needs specific builds to beat final bosses which ruins build variety and makes the game feel stale after playing the same four maps

i played and enjoyed the first game but the sequel seems to be over complicating the old formula the stagecoach driving fells pretty unnecessary you are also unable to hover over symbols in the game to understand what they mean you can reference a legend but it just seems like extra work the ui feels clunky having to right click on characters to equip items when left clicking on them does nothing

i nearly didnt purchase this because of the mixed reviews but im glad i took the gamble i actually like it better than the first sure its quite different but in my opinion in a good way i like the character interactionsrelationships and it has a more roguelike feel with less tedious overwhelming management stuff the carriage is cool and as with the first the atmosphere and narrator are enjoyable  maybe people just dont like change anyway id recommend giving it a go for yourself

ive been in love with darkest dungeon ii since its steam release in 2023 the game has seen its fair share of oddities and imperfections but looking at it now i can say confidently that red hooks commitment to the project has paid off in a big way and continues to do so  seeing ddii grow along with me over the past couple years has been wonderful theres never been a better time to give it a try

why are prequels usually worse voted than good original titles because people expect it to be the same but so much better its unrealistic dd2 makes a lot of stuff right like animations combos character development and roguelite  its not like the first game its different to me it feels improved especially with the new game mode kingdoms the core mechanics are pretty much the same than before  prob not worth 40 bucks but def a try if you like roguelite in general

darkest dungeon 2 is a turnbased ballshard roguelike strategy title  in a world without hope besieged by eldritch forces you will slowly very slowly turn the tides of battle and try to rebuild society  a ragtag group will slowly assemble as they attempt to push back the heart of darkness and rekindle mankinds spirit  it is tough surprisingly long full of random chance and utterly addicting

the first game is one of my all time favorites the second one is different a little more intense more options and the animations make the crew come alive i love it its punishing and unforgiving but so much fun there is a lot to learn but well worth it
